ACK fae4117ddeb5c2264f4d2b1cfcb436b68bd38e86

This has been needed for a very long time! Thanks for adding! :)

Could you do a test run in Travis in another branch where you introduce an intentional uninitialised read to verify that it is caught?
ACK fae4117ddeb5c2264f4d2b1cfcb436b68bd38e86\n\n(agree it would be nice to see a failing run as @practicalswift mentions)

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#17399](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17399.html) (validation: Templatize ValidationState inst
I don't see any valgrind output except for the benchmarks https://travis-ci.org/bitcoin/bitcoin/jobs/612624502#L2889
For the unit tests, it will only be printed on failure
Added a failing travis as requested by @practicalswift and @laanwj \n\nI will remove the failing commit *after* review, but *before* merge.
The failing travis build was https://travis-ci.org/bitcoin/bitcoin/builds/623456054\n\nWill reset the branch now

```suggestion\nexport PACKAGES="valgrind clang llvm python3-zmq libevent-dev bsdmainutils libboost-system-dev libboost-filesystem-dev libboost-chrono-dev libboost-test-dev libboost-thread-dev libdb5.3++-dev libminiupnpc-dev libzmq3-dev"\n```
